page.title: 08GRAVEL PIT RESTORATION, WARE
page.content: Pits have a limited life before being restored to beneficial use. One way of {infilling}makes use of household and builder's waste. About 600 lorries a day take{rubbish}to one landfill site where it is compacted by vehicles with spiked wheels.Eventually it is covered with layers of{clay}and{subsoil}before the original topsoil is replaced. As the rubbish decomposes it gives off {methane gas}which is released through pipes. Unfortunately, not all of the gas escapes harmlessly. Some grassland nearby is covered in{yellowish patches where the gas has seeped through.It is said to be harmless to grazing sheep but on the farm they are not so sure! The shepherd reckons that the restored fields will never be good enough for growing crops.Some of the land is very uneven where the{plastic waste}has not decayed and some is virtually useless.
